headline.main: 111 MORE CAPTIVES IN SHANGHAI LISTED; 97 of Marine Corps and 14 of the Navy Among Those Taken at Peiping and Tientsin FIVE FROM NEW YORK CITY Lieutenant Foley of Flushing One of Prisoners on Eighth List From Japanese

lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, July 1 -- The War Department made public today the names of 111 United States sailors and Marines who are held as prisoners of war by the Japanese at Shanghai. Seventy-two were serving at Peiping and thirty-nine at Tientsin.
abstract: US War Dept lists 111 US sailors and marines held by Japanese, Shanghai
snippet: WASHINGTON, July 1 -- The War Department made public today the names of 111 United States sailors and Marines who are held as prisoners of war by the Japanese at Shanghai. Seventy-two were serving at Peiping and thirty-nine at Tientsin....

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES
